data.name: Matching Words in an Acronym
data.description:
# Task
Your task is to create a function called `match_words()`. It will take two parameters:
- `acronym` - the acronym itself in uppercase as a string (e.g. `'LASER'`)
- `words` - the words (all in title case) that the acronym stands for as an array (not in order)

The goal of the function is to return a dictionary which shows which letter stands for each word. 

## Example
Each letter in `acronym` should be assigned a value.
```python
acronym = 'LASER'
words = ['Radiation','Stimulated','Light','Emission Of','Amplification By']
data = match_words(acronym,words)

# The following is now true:
data = {'L': 'Light','A': 'Amplification By','S': 'Stimulated','E':'Emission Of','R':'Radiation'}
```
## Notes
- The Input will only contain characters from the Latin/English alphabet.
- If the input is an empty array and empty string, return an empty dictionary.
- There will always be the same amount of values in `words` as there is letters in `acronym`.
- `acronym` will not contain the same character more than once (This is to simplify the task).
